ClsC_a3bea21b.class_description: Abstract information, meanings, or purposes that are conveyed or inferred in communication, including both explicit messages and underlying intentions.
ClsC_a3bea21b.evidence_excerpt: Intentions and messages are both described as information or purposes conveyed or inferred through nonverbal cues.

members.entity_description: Underlying plans, purposes, or desired actions that can be inferred or communicated through nonverbal body language cues.
members.resolution_context: All mentions refer to the same abstract concept of underlying plans or purposes inferred from body language in the same discourse context, differing only slightly in wording and type granularity.

members.entity_description: Information or meanings that can be conveyed through gestures without spoken language.
members.resolution_context: From waving hello to giving a thumbs up, gestures can convey a wide range of messages without the need for words.
